1.directions: This interactive demo uses a voice-based AI assistant to introduce you to the tools and equipment for your Gel Electrophoresis lab.
1.user_instructions: Ask any question to the AI agent!

2.description: Here is the benchtop centrifuge (the white unit with a flip-up lid and four buckets).
2.directions: Open the lid to see the rotor, then say “What does this do?” or click on the centrifuge.

3.description: Next is the mini heat block (gray base with a dark square platform).
3.directions: Touch the platform to feel how it holds tubes warm and say “How do I use this?” or click the heat block.

4.description: This is the vortex mixer (cream-colored body, black rubber pad labeled “Quest 2 Learn”).
4.directions: Place a tube on the pad and say “Mix sample” or click the pad to see it spin.

5.description: Here’s the gel tank (blue body, green lid) with red and gray leads attached.
5.directions: Lift the lid to view the gel tray, then say “Show me the inside” or click the tank.

6.description: This is the power supply (“Power Box Basic”—black top, white front with red & gray ports).
6.directions: Note the red port (+) and gray port (–). Say “How do I connect cables?” or click the power supply.

7.description: We’ll plug the red lead into + on the power box and the gray lead into –.
7.directions: Click each port to attach the cables, or say “Connect leads” to watch a demo.

8.description: Before you run any current, always close lids, wear goggles, and keep hands clear of liquids.
8.directions: Say “Safety confirmed” or click ‘Next’ when you’re ready to learn how to run a gel.
